docs.lead_paragraph: The forcible exile of a national from the Soviet Union as happened to Aleksandr I Solzhenitsyn yesterday, is a highly unusual step without apparent basis in existing Sovlet law. Leon Trotsky, a foe of Stalin, in France after his expulsion from the Soviet Union in 1929. He was slain in Mexico in 1940 by a Soviet agent.
